document_data.name: Tarm
document_data.symbol: A golden candle-lamp, whip, and bugle on a red field with a white bend sinister.
document_data.mainbody: The '''Tarm''' ({{Pronounce|TARM|refs=}}) family were one of the noble houses in [[Waterdeep]] ''circa'' the {{YearlinkName|1372}}. They were [[horse]] breeders and trainers, and had significant interests in caravan mastering.
document_data.Organization: The Tarm clan made their fortune in the caravan business and were well-known for the horses they bred and trained. From at least the {{YearlinkName|1357}}, to at least the {{YearlinkName|1372}}, the patriarch of the family was Lord [[Thentivil Tarm|Thentivil]]. His consort was Lady [[Selpara Tarm|Selpara]] and their son and heir was [[Arum Tarm|Arum]].
document_data.History: The Tarm clan were of [[Tethyrian]] descent and followers of [[Mielikki]]. The family was ennobled in the {{YearlinkName|1249}}. As of 1372 DR, there were forty-five living members.

document_data.Rumors & Legends: Lord Elevur Tarm was observed carrying on a conversation with a painting at one of the annual revels hosted by Lord [[Narrovan Eagleshield]] in honor of his deceased wife [[Embrelle Eagleshield|Embrelle]]. Rampant gossip ensued and Lord Elevur wanted no part of it, saying it was a private matter. This revived the legend of the [[Lost Dragon of Waterdeep]] for a time, and there were other proposed explanations as well.{{Cite dragon/414/Eye on the Realms: The Lost Dragon of Waterdeep|2}}
